header.title: Frequently Asked Questions
header.subtitle: Everything you need to know about implementing Curify in your organization.

medical-office.question: Is there integration with e-Prescription systems?
medical-office.answer: Yes. Curify offers full, bidirectional integration. You can issue prescriptions and referrals directly within the application, without accessing the e-Prescription portal.

medical-office.question: Does it automatically connect with tax authorities?
medical-office.answer: Absolutely. With every receipt or invoice issued, Curify automatically transmits the documents to the tax system, ensuring your tax compliance without accounting errors.

medical-office.question: Can I use it from my mobile phone?
medical-office.answer: Yes. Curify is a Cloud application. You have access to patient files and your schedule from any mobile or tablet, wherever you are.

clinic.question: Can I hide medical data from reception staff?
clinic.answer: Yes. With the role-based access control (RBAC) system, reception has access only to appointments and financial data, while medical history remains locked and visible only to doctors.

clinic.question: We have an old system. Do we lose our data?
clinic.answer: No. We handle data migration. We safely transfer your historical data from legacy systems to Curify.

clinic.question: Does it support different medical specialties?
clinic.answer: Yes. The system adapts. The Cardiologist sees fields for ECG, while the Dermatologist sees body mapping, all within the same unified platform.

hospital.question: Does it connect with laboratories (LIS) and PACS?
hospital.answer: Yes. We support HL7 and FHIR standards. We create bridges so laboratory tests and imaging automatically appear in the patient's file.

hospital.question: Can it be installed on our own server?
hospital.answer: For large facilities (Enterprise), we offer on-premise installation or Private Cloud options to meet strict IT security requirements.

hospital.question: Are we covered for GDPR compliance?
hospital.answer: Fully. We use AES-256 encryption and maintain detailed audit logs for every user, ensuring compliance with EU regulations.
